VILAL: SEIZE CONSTANCE.
CONSTANCE: Unhand me, you brutes! (STRUGGLES)
ANA: Henry?
HENRY: No. Not Constance. That was not the agreement!
CONSTANCE: Agreement?
FLIP: You’re handing me over to these metal-plated mud-men?
VILAL GENERAL: You are both friends of the Doctor. So the Vilal will take you both.
CONSTANCE: (SINKING IN) This girl’s a friend of the Doctor’s...?
FLIP: Well, duh.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 69
QUICKSILVER: SCENE 50: EXT. BOMBED OUT VIENNA BACKSTREET
CONTINUING: SCENE 48, DOCTOR AND KINVAR MARCHED ALONG BACKSTREET BY BOYAROV AND SOLDIERS.
BOYAROV: Stop. Here will do.
ALL: HALT.
DOCTOR: We are not the spies here. We have just removed the spying equipment.
BOYAROV: So. You admit that is what these devices are for! Men. Present arms.
SOLDIERS: DRAW WEAPONS.
DOCTOR: There really is no need for this...
BOYAROV: One of you will die and one of you will talk. That is how it usually works with spies.
DOCTOR: But we’ve already told you the truth!
BOYAROV: Let us see if the story remains the same after the first bullets are fired. Ready weapons.
SOLDIERS: RAISE WEAPONS.
KINVAR: Doctor? They’re going to shoot us!
DOCTOR: It does rather look that way.
BOYAROV: Take aim.
SOLDIERS: STEP FORWARD, RACKING WEAPONS.
SOLDIERS: END OF PART TWO
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 70

elements.text: PART THREE
Take aim!
STEP FORWARD, RACKING WEAPONS.
SCENE 51: EXT. BOMBED OUT VIENNA BACKSTREET
Sorry, Kinvar! I need your pendant! (GRABS KINVAR’S PENDANT)
PULLS PENDANT FROM CHAIN.
(CONCENTRATING) And I’m afraid this will hurt.
PULSING OF VILAL DEVICES THROUGHOUT.
& SOLDIERS:
REACT IN CONFUSION
(IN PAIN) Agh!
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 71
SCENE 52: INT. HENRY’S SHOP
PULSING OF VILAL PSYCHIC DEVICES FROM FAR OFF THROUGHOUT.
CRIES OF CONFUSION, CONTINUES THROUGH
They’re confused. They’ve let go!
You changing your mind, Captain Saucepan-head? (EFFORT BREAKING FREE)
(IN PAIN) Agh. Someone... tries to control us. It is not right! Not the right mind!
FLAIL IN PAIN. FLIP BREAKS FREE.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 72
SCENE 53: EXT. BOMBED OUT VIENNA BACKSTREET
SCENE 51. PULSING OF VILAL DEVICES CONTINUES.
(COMMANDING) Stop. All of you. You don’t want to fire. You want to lower your weapons.
(FALLING UNDER HIS PSYCHIC INFLUENCE) That... That is right. We will lower our guns.
LOWER WEAPONS.
(IN PAIN) Agh! You are using the Quicksilver devices...
(CLOSE) I’m using the psionic crystal to activate them. As I said, psychic control!
What... is happening?
CONFUSION
(ALOUD) You have seen our papers, everything is order. We’re upgrading the telephone lines. We can take our equipment and go on our way.
Yes, yes. Of course. I hope the work goes well.
PICKS UP THE DEVICES.
I have them all.
Apologies for any interruption.
Not at all. Good to know security is in safe hands. Mr Kinvar? Come along!
DOCTOR AND KINVAR HURRY OFF.
(WINCES IN PAIN, GOING OFF) Agh! My head!
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 73
(GOING OFF) Don’t worry, I’1ll turn Quicksilver off once we’re clear!
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 74
SCENE 54: INT. HENRY’S SHOP
SCENE 52. FLIP HAS BROKEN FREE, LOOKING FOR A WAY OUT. PULSING OF VILAL PSYCHIC DEVICES FROM FAR OFF CONTINUES.
They’re blocking the door! We can’t get out!
Stop right there, young lady. (GRABBING FLIP)
Agh!
(STRUGGLING TO HOLD FLIP) General Vilal? Do you need her or not? Constance! Come here!
Stay away from me. And let go of that poor girl. Philippa?
BREAKING FREE) It’s just.. Flip! (EFFORT
KNEES HENRY IN THE UNMENTIONABLES.
CRIES IN PAIN
BREAKS FREE.
Henry! Come here.
(IN PAIN) I suppose I deserved that.
Goodness, young Flip. You’ve quite some pluck!
Yeah? Well, it’s still not gonna get us past those armoured hobgoblins. (HEADS INTO BACK OF SHOP) There’s a back way out. Through the storeroom. This way, Connie!
(FOLLOWING) Constance!
CONSTANCE AND FLIP RUN TO BACK ROOM. PULSING OF VILAL DEVICES
(DOCTOR HAS TURNED THEM OFF ELSEWHERE).
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 75
(RECOVERING) The signal has stopped. (ROAR OF FRUSTRATION) No! They are gone!
WEAPON FIRE BLASTS SHOP WALL.
(ROAR) Vilal will not surrender!
(CALLING) General Vilal! You said she would not be harmed! She’d be returned to her companion! Stop shooting and listen!
VILAL BLASTS, DESTROYING SHOP. WALL COLLAPSES. ANA DRAGS
AWAY.
(PULLING HENRY BACK) They are mad! What is wrong with your friends? They are destroying our shop!
Not exactly friends, Ana. (LEADING HER OUT) We need to get out before anyone starts asking questions.
HENRY AND ANA HURRY OUT INTO STREET.
Search this building! Tear it apart! Where did they go?
STOMP AROUND, BLASTING REMAINS OF SHOP.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 76
SCENE 55: INT. PASSAGEWAY
FLIP AND CONSTANCE HURRY ALONG PASSAGE.
ROAR, OFF
I’m afraid this is a dead end.
(ROAR, OFF) Vilal will find you!
I’m not running back there into the arms of Mr Grumpy.
We may not have a choice.
STARTS FEELING ALONG WALLS.
No. I’ve seen them come down here and disappear. Mr and Mrs
Cook. There must be another way out... What do you reckon?
Well. I ‘reckon’ this is an odd place to put a candleholder...
PULLS ON LEVER. A HIDDEN DOOR UNLOCKS.
Here!
Secret passage! Nice work Connie!
THEY RUN INTO PASSAGEWAY. VILAL STOMP CLOSER, OFF.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 77
SCENE 56: EXT. OUTSIDE HENRY’S SHOP
STOMP ONTO STREET.
They are gone, General. There is no trace!
Failure! We cannot afford failure! (ROAR)
GENERAL FIRES AT SHOP.
Destroy this place! Then return to the ship! Humans cannot be
trusted!
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 78
SCENE 57: EXT. FURTHER OFF, NEAR HENRY’S SHOP (CONTINUOUS)
DESTRUCTION OF SHOP ONGOING, OFF. HENRY AND ANA RUN CLEAR.
(BREATHLESS) Henry! Our shop! Our home.
(BREATHLESS) Up in smoke.
What have we done? Should we go back?
I think they’re beyond making deals. We need another way out.
The patrols will come.
And we don’t want to be here when they arrive.
THEY HURRY OFF.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 79
SCENE 58: EXT. OUTSIDE HENRY’S SHOP
FIRE-TRUCK BELLS. ACTIVITY PUTTING OUT FLAMES. LAND ROVERS PULL UP AND SOLDIERS DISEMBARK.
(GETTING OUT) Good Lord. Any survivors?
No, Major Callahan, sir!
I suppose all we can do is douse the flames and search the ruins. (SOTTO) Quicksilver can’t have been compromised?
LAND ROVERS ARRIVE. BOYAROV AND SOLDIERS APPROACH.
(CALLING) Ah. Major Boyarov. I have to ask. Did you know anything about this?
(APPROACHING) The first I knew was the smoke. We are supposed to be protecting the city. Not blowing it up.
I must consider all possibilities.
Huh. What argument would I have with some Englishman’s tailor shop? I know where to get good suits. In the Russian zone.
I wonder. (CLOSE) Boyarov, do you think this new weapon is involved?
(CLOSE) It could be. If this wasn’t a bomb-
(CLOSE) I don’t think it was. There were reports of armoured ‘figures’.
(CLOSE) Then it is like nothing I have seen. (CALLING) You men, bring more water!
RUNNING, OFF. FIRES BEING PUT OUT.
Our people have things in hand. I must file a report. (WALKS
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 80
Yes. It only remains to find out what in heaven’s name caused
ats
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 81
SCENE 59: EXT. VIENNA STREET, FURTHER OFF (CONTINUOUS)
APPROACHES ALONG STREET WITH KINVAR. DISTANT SOUNDS OF
SEARCHING RUBBLE.
Look. Destruction.
All the hallmarks of your Vilal pursuers. They’ve most definitely hit town. We should get you back undercover. And I need to find out where Constance is.
We’re going back to the TARDIS?
We’ve done what we came to do. Found your dangerous devices. Let’s get them — and you - out of danger. (HEADING OFF) Come on, the Hofburg’s this way.
THEY HURRY ON.
(IN DISTANCE) I’m going back to HQ. Keep me updated. I'd
especially like to know if we find any trace of the owners.
(IN DISTANCE) Yes, sir!
ROVERS START UP AND DRIVE OFF.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 82
SCENE 60: INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
CLOSE. DOCTOR GOES TO ROUNDELS AND STARTS PULLING OUT
DRAWERS.
Constance is out there somewhere, and she is my responsibility! She wanted to go home. But I had to keep meddling...
I am sorry, Doctor. This is all my fault.
No, Kinvar. It’s mine. You’1l need to stay here. I don’t want to lose another one of my wards today. But I need help with the search...
PULLS ANOTHER DRAWER AND SORTS THROUGH BITS AND PIECES.
My storage system is a little erratic. Mrs Clarke was helping me reorganise.. ‘I’ for ‘Identification’.. papers, passports.
HE PULLS OUT ANOTHER ROUNDEL.
Now where did I put that... (FINDING PAPERS) Ah-ha!
Please Doctor. I’d like to help.
HURRIES TO CONSOLE AND OPENS DOORS.
I’m afraid you’d be a liability. (HEADING OUT, CALLING BACK) The most useful thing you can do right now is stay put.
CLOSE.
(TO SELF) If only I’d ‘stayed put’ in the first place, none of this would have happened...
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 83
SCENE 61: INT. VIENNA SEWERS
METAL DOORWAY PUSHED OPEN. CONSTANCE AND FLIP STEP
INTO SEWERS. TRICKLING WATER, ECHOING AMBIENCE.
Good grief. It rather pongs.
Nothing compared to the White Rabbit at kicking-out time.
These are the city sewers. The water’s running that way. If I remember my European geography correctly, they empty out into the river. The Danube.
Don’t look at me. That’s another GCSE they didn’t let me do.
I suppose if we follow the flow, we might find a way out.
Sounds like a plan. Let’s go.
THEY HURRY THROUGH FOLLOWING.
I’ll keep an eye out for any ladders. We might be able to get up to a manhole. I don’t really fancy swimming.
Good idea. I must say, these tunnels are rather a grand affair.
Yeah. I’ve cleaned the loos in Freshgoods. It’s definitely a step up from that.
I can tell you’re a friend of the Doctor’s, you know. I haven’t the slightest idea what you’re talking about!
Freshgoods. It’s a supermarket. Used to work on the cheese counter sometimes. (HURRIES ON AHEAD, CALLING BACK) Come to think of it, that didn’t half whiff too.
(TAKING A MOMENT) Well, quite.
FOLLOWS ON.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 84
SCENE 62: INT. CALLAHAN’S OFFICE
CALLAHAN ON PHONE.
No sir. There is no indication that Quicksilver has been compromised. I simply need to find our operative.
(INDISTINCT, VIA PHONE) [‘Keep me informed’ ].
Very good sir. Immediately I know more, I shall update you.
DOWN PHONE. DOOR BURSTS OPEN.
(OUTSIDE DOOR) Major Callahan? Sorry to arrive unannounced.
What is the meaning of this?
BREEZES IN.
(ENTERING) But I rather thought in the circumstances, the British liaison for Allied security would want to see me anyway. So I took the liberty of circumventing procedure.
What the devil? Who are you??
PUTS PAPERS ON TABLE.
My credentials.
(CHECKING PAPERS) These are from Station X. Signed by... Good Lord.
You’11 find I have the highest security clearance.
Nobody told me you’d be coming... (CHECKS PAPERS) Dr Smith.
Of course not. I’d hardly be a very good spy if everyone knows where I’m going to turn up next.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 85
(FLUSTERED) Of course.
I’1l cut to the chase, Major Callahan. Quicksilver is to be suspended.
What? I just got off the phone to-
I know. And my clearance outranks the General’s.
I’1l need to confirm.
Be my guest. This is a matter of public safety. Every minute you delay, lives are in danger. You have evidence already in the form of a smoking hole where Harry Cook’s tailor shop used to be.
The attack was connected to Quicksilver?
Rather a coincidence if it wasn’t! First of all, I need a curfew put in place.
Absolutely. I’1l get on to Allied Control. Major Boyarov can co-ordinate.
PICKS UP PHONE.
And I’d like access to your agent, Lieutenant Commander Clarke.
(STOPS MID-DIAL) You know about him too? Good Lord.
Actually, my special interest is Mrs Clarke.
Well, I’ve no idea where either of them is.
In that case, I need everyone available out looking.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 86
SCENE 63: EXT. VIENNA STREETS
ROVERS DRIVE PAST. PEOPLE ARE USHERED OFF THE STREETS.
Inside, please!/ Off the streets!/ Curfew!

(VIA LOUDHAILER) Please return to your homes. This is a matter of security. There is no need to be alarmed. But you must return indoors and remain there. We need the streets to be clear. Until oh-seven hundred hours tomorrow.
(MUTTERED CONCERN) What’s happening?/ What’s going on? [ETC]
CLOSING, PEOPLE HURRYING AWAY. LAND ROVERS DRIVE ON.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 87
SCENE 64: INT. VIENNA SEWERS
WATER. CONSTANCE AND FLIP WALKING THROUGH SEWERS.
No signs of pursuit. We can probably afford to slow down.
No chance. If the Doctor’s here, I want to see him soon as!
You know about the TARDIS. So I take it, you may not be from this world and time?
Oh I’m definitely from this world. The year twenty-twelve though. I guess that’s your future: you seem a lot more at home here than me!
I suppose this is near enough my native time. I met the Doctor during the war.
You mean World War Two? Nineteen-forties?
Well done. You have some grasp of history after all.
Mum’s dad. My grandad. He was a kid when it started. But he used to tell stories about his dad. He flew planes.
Your great-grandfather? You’re making me feel quite ancient.
Hey, I don’t suppose you might have met him? You never know.
It would be highly improbable.
Yeah. I hate it when people do that... Like when you meet someone on holiday, and you say you live in London. And they say — “Oh, do you know John Smith, he lives in London too!” (BEAT) I don’t
even know the people next door.
I suppose the past is a country all its own. Although we do have a John Smith in common.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 88
Oh yeah, he does call himself that sometimes. (LAUGHS) Just think. You could even be my great-gran!
(SADLY) No. No, I couldn’t. (BEAT, CHANGING SUBJECT) Twenty- twelve. My word. The future of womankind.
Umm... So. You’re my replacement are you?
Difficult to say. The Doctor doesn’t exactly do things in chronological order.
Good point.
I know. Does he still wear (WITH FLIP) that coat?
(WITH CONSTANCE) That coat?! Yeah.
& FLIP:
LAUGH
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 89
SCENE 65: INT. VIENNA SEWER TUNNEL, FURTHER OFF
CONTINUOUS
AS FLIP AND CONSTANCE WALK ON AHEAD, A SHARP CRACKLING IN THE AIR, AS WHEN THE ZERITH COMMUNICATE.
& FLIP:
LAUGHING
(OFF) Did you travel with him for long?
(OFF) Quite a while. But, you know, when you’re enjoying yourself, things always go too fast.
(OFF) Time is relative, as the Doctor would say. Why did you stop?
(OFF) Wasn’t exactly my choice. I ended up back at home. Things kind of ran away with me...
AS FLIP AND CONSTANCE WALK OFF, ZERITH CREATURES START APPEARING. GLASS INSECTOID LIMBS SCRAPING.
The enemy is here. And they are diminished. Come, my Zerith Sisters. We shall finish this.
ZERITH CRACKLING AND SCRAPING AS THEY APPEAR AND STEP
SEWERS.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 90
SCENE 66: INT. VILAL SHIP
CLUNKING, HUMMING VILAL TECHNOLOGY, ON ITS LAST LEGS.
Captain, report. (STOPS HIM) No. No need. I hear my ship dying. This is where we end. Buried in rubble on an insignificant world. The trade with the human failed.
They adapted our components, named them Quicksilver. Used them for their own petty purposes. But someone else activated the psychic component.
The Doctor?
That is how they confused us. (BEAT) General, there may still be a chance. If Kinvar holds the Quicksilver devices-
(INTERRUPTS) Yes! Use our remaining power. Contact Kinvar. It is our only hope. Even if it risks damaging his mind...
CAPTAIN ACTIVATES PSYCHIC SIGNALS.
All power diverted to psychic signal. Contacting Quicksilver. Hailing Kinvar! (DISTORTED, AS SENT OUT OVER PSYCHIC SIGNAL)
Hailing Kinvar!
PSYCHIC SIGNAL RECEIVED, RESOLVING ITSELF INTO KINVAR’S CRY OF PAIN.
(DISTORTED) Aaarggh!
It causes pain.
We have no choice. All available power. Weapon systems too!
INCREASES.
(VIA PSYCHIC LINK) Aaargh! What are you doing!
Hear us. The enemy is close. We need you.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 91
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 92
SCENE 67: INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
DEVICES ARE GOING CRAZY, BUZZING, PULSING.
CRIES OF PAIN
DOORS OPEN. DOCTOR STRIDES IN.
(ENTERING) I’ve enlisted the help of the local militia. So that should help cover the — [ground].
RUSHES TO KINVAR’S SIDE.
Kinvar!
MOANING IN PAIN
(DISTORTED, VIA QUICKSILVER DEVICES ) Kinvar! Hear us! Come to our aid!
(CALLING) Leave him alone!
(D) He is ours! You do not understand.
You Vilal have mind control technology. Psychic devices. Vortex scanning technology! Getting whatever you want should be a piece of cake.
(D) We need him.
Yet for some reason, you are not the formidable force you should be.
(D) We want Kinvar. We have one of your associates in our power. We demand an exchange.
Constance? You have Constance?
(D) No. Another.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 93
Whoever it is. Let me speak to them.
(D) Give us Kinvar first!
Don’t think threatening my friends will gain you anything other than my enmity! I will not be bullied!
Don’t let them take me, Doctor, please.
(D) Kinvar is required!
That much is clear. But for what purpose? I don’t think you do want to hurt him.
(D) No. Kinvar must be unharmed.
(IN PAIN) They want me... want to force me to fight.
I think it's time you all told me exactly what’s going on.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 94
SCENE 68: INT. FERRIS WHEEL CARRIAGE
HENRY AND ANA HURRY INTO FERRIS WHEEL CARRIAGE.
Mr and Mrs Cook. Fancy meeting you two on the ferris wheel.
Fancy.
Dobry den, Major Boyarov.
Shall we ride?
SLIDES CARRIAGE DOOR CLOSED. FERRIS WHEEL TURNS UNDER FOLLOWING.
I hear the clothes trade has taken a sudden downturn. (BEAT) You were not observed coming here?
We never have been before.
I know what’s at stake.
This arrangement may be more trouble than it is worth.
You made promises, Major. Are you not a man of honour?
Our exit to the east may need a little hurrying along.
Such a shame for the British to lose such an officer. I imagine it will cost them quite a lot.
You want more money from us?
We have given all we have.
You want this done quicker? Then there are expenses.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 95
Take away the insignia and you’re a crook, Boyarov. Taking a cut from every black market deal any Russian has a hand in.
Henry!
Listen to Ana. That is not polite. If you wish me to help you enjoy a retirement in the countryside, then I need a little more.
I will not sell out my country. Is the money not enough?
Should Major Callahan hear of this defection, I do not think he would understand. One thing more I require. A sample of your new technology. Your listening devices.
There’s no such thing.
Come now. Even I have heard whispers of a name. ‘Quicksilver’. I am not asking for betrayal. Simply something our scientists can use.
It won’t be easy.
Nothing worthwhile ever is. It would be proof of your good faith. And as proof of mine, I will ensure Mrs Cook is looked after. Until you return. (DRAWS GUN, GRABS ANA)
A gun? (REACTS, GRABBED) What is happening?
Your papers, Ana. (TAKING PAPERS) You remain in the Russian zone until Mr Clarke completes this task.
You’re a disgrace to the uniform, Boyarov.
You think this is how to win favour?
I’m sorry. But if you threaten my wife-
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 96
(INTERRUPTS) As I understand it, your ‘wife’ is wandering elsewhere in Vienna. What complicated lives you decadent Westerners live...
Why, you-
(INTERRUPTS) Henry, please. I will do what the Major says. We can be away from here and in Romania by tomorrow.
Listen. Ana speaks sense.
Very well.
I am a man of my word, Mr Clarke. Bring me that technology, and you will both be free to travel wherever you wish.
The components are in the cable tunnels behind our shop. I should still be able to get to them through the wreckage.
WHEEL CLANKS HOME.
Good. We have come full circle. I suggest you go now.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 97
SCENE 69: INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
HUMMING OF VILAL PSYCHIC DEVICES.
I’m sorry.
An explanation, please. I’m waiting.
(D) Kinvar is necessary to us. We cannot function without him.
I’m going to need more of an explanation than that.

(D) The Vilal are dedicated to war. We learned long ago that the best way to wage it was to divide ourselves. Strength, power, force, obedience. These qualities are distilled in our footsoldiers, the Vilal. Intelligence, logic, and cunning we split into another vessel.
Specialisation. Well, that’s one evolutionary option...
(D) That vessel is Kinvar. We need him to direct this war.
Are you saying Kinvar is your... ‘battle computer’?
(D) Every generation, a new Vilal Helm is prepared. Bred for the task. All knowledge, all history, all strategies are fed into the mind as it matures.
Like programming a machine.
(D) When the Helm comes of age, becomes self-aware, then the psychic link is made. Kinvar fled before that was done.
Homilies involving eggs and baskets spring to mind.
I awoke. I saw my future. Chained to this army. I did not choose to fight. So I ran.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 98
I see. You’re an organic A.I. More than that, a living being whose purpose is determined by directed evolution. But in your case, self-awareness provoked a new emotion. Fear.
I am no coward. But I do not wish to kill.
Sometimes it takes more courage to turn away from the fight. You bred him too well, Vilal. Self-preservation may well be the purest evolutionary trait!

(D) Our enemy hunt us to extinction. Without direction, without intelligence, we are easy prey. My expedition was Vilal’s last hope. But I am no strategist. I can only respond to stimuli, guess at the best course. Without Kinvar, we face defeat.
What’s it all for? Who is your enemy?
CRACKLING OF ZERITH TRANSMISSION BREAKING INTO QUICKSILVER SIGNAL.
(DISTORTED) (LAUGHS) We hear all! And we are close. We sense the final defeat of the Vilal.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 99
SCENE 70: INT. VIENNA SEWERS
FLIP AND CONSTANCE HURRY ON THROUGH SEWERS.
It doesn’t sound like you wanted to stop travelling.
I didn’t. But when I got home... Jared was there. He’d waited all that time.
Jared? Your young man.
He asked me to marry him. It seemed so romantic.
Yes. It can often seem that way.

Before I knew it, we were making seating plans, ordering party poppers and booking a DJ. (ASIDE) I knew we should never have asked Dodgy Steve. (SIGH) It was a good party. Even Mum and Creepy Nigel were having a good time. I’d nipped outside, to clear my head, when this weird thing came for me. I woke up here.
And ‘Mr and Mrs Cook’ found you and took you in. On behalf of those creatures.
They seemed nice. I never realised they were babysitting me for Trolls R Us, and whatever they want me for.
Henry wouldn’t have let them harm you. I’m certain of it.
I’ve just thought... My wedding reception... it’s still going on. I’m supposed to be doing Gangnam Style!
(SIGH) Is it worth it? For a night of champagne and dancing?
I wasn’t drinking. You see- (STOPS) Oh no. I’m sorry, Connie. Here’s me going on about weddings and you’ve just found your husband... well. Knocking about with another woman.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 100
This morning I thought he was dead. Now, I wish that he were. (BEAT) No. That’s not right, Constance. You’re better than that. Stronger than that.
Too right. Jared is.. Well, he’s there. And he’s nice. But...
TAILS OFF
There should never be a ‘but’ where your wedding day is concerned.
SCRAPING ALONG IN SEWERS, OFF.
Shh! Did you hear that?
I believe I did.
Maybe we should get a shift on. Here, look over on the wall.
Hold on. I’ve a torch... (CHECKS) Oh. I don’t. I usually do, only I don’t have my uniform.
Proper girl guide, aren’t you? And I’ve lost my mobile. Back in the reception hall with my lime and soda. I reckon we should just leg it up here! (CLIMBING TO LEDGE)
(FOLLOWING) ‘Leg it’ indeed. I see stairs! In the alcove ahead. Step to it, Miss Flip. You were right.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 101
SCENE 71: INT. RUINED PASSAGEWAY BEHIND HENRY’S SHOP
PULLING RUBBLE OUT OF WAY. SEARCHING THROUGH CABLES.
(SEARCHING) Oh no...
SEARCHING.
Quicksilver! Every box... Gone!
HE HITS WALL IN FRUSTRATION.
MUSIC TRANSITION.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 102
SCENE 72: INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
HUMMING OF VILAL PSYCHIC DEVICES.

VILAL GENERAL: (D) He is ours! You do not understand.
DOCTOR: You Vilal have mind control technology. Psychic devices. Vortex scanning technology! Getting whatever you want should be a piece of cake.
VILAL GENERAL: (D) We need him.
DOCTOR: Yet for some reason, you are not the formidable force you should be.
VILAL GENERAL: (D) We want Kinvar. We have one of your associates in our power. We demand an exchange.
DOCTOR: Constance? You have Constance?
VILAL GENERAL: (D) No. Another.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 93
DOCTOR: Whoever it is. Let me speak to them.
VILAL GENERAL: (D) Give us Kinvar first!
DOCTOR: Don’t think threatening my friends will gain you anything other than my enmity! I will not be bullied!
KINVAR: Don’t let them take me, Doctor, please.
VILAL GENERAL: (D) Kinvar is required!
DOCTOR: That much is clear. But for what purpose? I don’t think you do want to hurt him.
VILAL GENERAL: (D) No. Kinvar must be unharmed.
KINVAR: (IN PAIN) They want me... want to force me to fight.
DOCTOR: I think it's time you all told me exactly what’s going on.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 94
QUICKSILVER: SCENE 68: INT. FERRIS WHEEL CARRIAGE
QUICKSILVER: HENRY AND ANA HURRY INTO FERRIS WHEEL CARRIAGE.
BOYAROV: Mr and Mrs Cook. Fancy meeting you two on the ferris wheel.
HENRY: Fancy.
ANA: Dobry den, Major Boyarov.
BOYAROV: Shall we ride?
BORAYOV: SLIDES CARRIAGE DOOR CLOSED. FERRIS WHEEL TURNS UNDER FOLLOWING.
BOYAROV: I hear the clothes trade has taken a sudden downturn. (BEAT) You were not observed coming here?
ANA: We never have been before.
HENRY: I know what’s at stake.
BOYAROV: This arrangement may be more trouble than it is worth.
ANA: You made promises, Major. Are you not a man of honour?
HENRY: Our exit to the east may need a little hurrying along.
BOYAROV: Such a shame for the British to lose such an officer. I imagine it will cost them quite a lot.
HENRY: You want more money from us?
ANA: We have given all we have.
BOYAROV: You want this done quicker? Then there are expenses.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 95
HENRY: Take away the insignia and you’re a crook, Boyarov. Taking a cut from every black market deal any Russian has a hand in.
ANA: Henry!
BOYAROV: Listen to Ana. That is not polite. If you wish me to help you enjoy a retirement in the countryside, then I need a little more.
HENRY: I will not sell out my country. Is the money not enough?
BOYAROV: Should Major Callahan hear of this defection, I do not think he would understand. One thing more I require. A sample of your new technology. Your listening devices.
HENRY: There’s no such thing.
BOYAROV: Come now. Even I have heard whispers of a name. ‘Quicksilver’. I am not asking for betrayal. Simply something our scientists can use.
HENRY: It won’t be easy.
BOYAROV: Nothing worthwhile ever is. It would be proof of your good faith. And as proof of mine, I will ensure Mrs Cook is looked after. Until you return. (DRAWS GUN, GRABS ANA)
ANA: A gun? (REACTS, GRABBED) What is happening?
BOYAROV: Your papers, Ana. (TAKING PAPERS) You remain in the Russian zone until Mr Clarke completes this task.
HENRY: You’re a disgrace to the uniform, Boyarov.
BOYAROV: You think this is how to win favour?
HENRY: I’m sorry. But if you threaten my wife-
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 96
BOYAROV: (INTERRUPTS) As I understand it, your ‘wife’ is wandering elsewhere in Vienna. What complicated lives you decadent Westerners live...
HENRY: Why, you-
ANA: (INTERRUPTS) Henry, please. I will do what the Major says. We can be away from here and in Romania by tomorrow.
BOYAROV: Listen. Ana speaks sense.
HENRY: Very well.
BOYAROV: I am a man of my word, Mr Clarke. Bring me that technology, and you will both be free to travel wherever you wish.
HENRY: The components are in the cable tunnels behind our shop. I should still be able to get to them through the wreckage.
FERRIS: WHEEL CLANKS HOME.
BOYAROV: Good. We have come full circle. I suggest you go now.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 97
QUICKSILVER: SCENE 69: INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
QUICKSILVER: HUMMING OF VILAL PSYCHIC DEVICES.
KINVAR: I’m sorry.
DOCTOR: An explanation, please. I’m waiting.
VILAL GENERAL: (D) Kinvar is necessary to us. We cannot function without him.
DOCTOR: I’m going to need more of an explanation than that.
VILAL GENERAL: (D) The Vilal are dedicated to war. We learned long ago that the best way to wage it was to divide ourselves. Strength, power, force, obedience. These qualities are distilled in our footsoldiers, the Vilal. Intelligence, logic, and cunning we split into another vessel.
DOCTOR: Specialisation. Well, that’s one evolutionary option...
VILAL GENERAL: (D) That vessel is Kinvar. We need him to direct this war.
DOCTOR: Are you saying Kinvar is your... ‘battle computer’?
VILAL GENERAL: (D) Every generation, a new Vilal Helm is prepared. Bred for the task. All knowledge, all history, all strategies are fed into the mind as it matures.
DOCTOR: Like programming a machine.
VILAL GENERAL: (D) When the Helm comes of age, becomes self-aware, then the psychic link is made. Kinvar fled before that was done.
DOCTOR: Homilies involving eggs and baskets spring to mind.
KINVAR: I awoke. I saw my future. Chained to this army. I did not choose to fight. So I ran.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 98
DOCTOR: I see. You’re an organic A.I. More than that, a living being whose purpose is determined by directed evolution. But in your case, self-awareness provoked a new emotion. Fear.
KINVAR: I am no coward. But I do not wish to kill.
DOCTOR: Sometimes it takes more courage to turn away from the fight. You bred him too well, Vilal. Self-preservation may well be the purest evolutionary trait!
VILAL GENERAL: (D) Our enemy hunt us to extinction. Without direction, without intelligence, we are easy prey. My expedition was Vilal’s last hope. But I am no strategist. I can only respond to stimuli, guess at the best course. Without Kinvar, we face defeat.
DOCTOR: What’s it all for? Who is your enemy?
DOCTOR: CRACKLING OF ZERITH TRANSMISSION BREAKING INTO QUICKSILVER SIGNAL.
ZERITH: (DISTORTED) (LAUGHS) We hear all! And we are close. We sense the final defeat of the Vilal.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 99
QUICKSILVER: SCENE 70: INT. VIENNA SEWERS
QUICKSILVER: FLIP AND CONSTANCE HURRY ON THROUGH SEWERS.
CONSTANCE: It doesn’t sound like you wanted to stop travelling.
FLIP: I didn’t. But when I got home... Jared was there. He’d waited all that time.
CONSTANCE: Jared? Your young man.
FLIP: He asked me to marry him. It seemed so romantic.
CONSTANCE: Yes. It can often seem that way.
FLIP: Before I knew it, we were making seating plans, ordering party poppers and booking a DJ. (ASIDE) I knew we should never have asked Dodgy Steve. (SIGH) It was a good party. Even Mum and Creepy Nigel were having a good time. I’d nipped outside, to clear my head, when this weird thing came for me. I woke up here.
CONSTANCE: And ‘Mr and Mrs Cook’ found you and took you in. On behalf of those creatures.
FLIP: They seemed nice. I never realised they were babysitting me for Trolls R Us, and whatever they want me for.
CONSTANCE: Henry wouldn’t have let them harm you. I’m certain of it.
FLIP: I’ve just thought... My wedding reception... it’s still going on. I’m supposed to be doing Gangnam Style!
CONSTANCE: (SIGH) Is it worth it? For a night of champagne and dancing?
FLIP: I wasn’t drinking. You see- (STOPS) Oh no. I’m sorry, Connie. Here’s me going on about weddings and you’ve just found your husband... well. Knocking about with another woman.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 100
CONSTANCE: This morning I thought he was dead. Now, I wish that he were. (BEAT) No. That’s not right, Constance. You’re better than that. Stronger than that.
FLIP: Too right. Jared is.. Well, he’s there. And he’s nice. But...
CONSTANCE: There should never be a ‘but’ where your wedding day is concerned.
ZERITH: SCRAPING ALONG IN SEWERS, OFF.
FLIP: Shh! Did you hear that?
CONSTANCE: I believe I did.
FLIP: Maybe we should get a shift on. Here, look over on the wall.
CONSTANCE: Hold on. I’ve a torch... (CHECKS) Oh. I don’t. I usually do, only I don’t have my uniform.
FLIP: Proper girl guide, aren’t you? And I’ve lost my mobile. Back in the reception hall with my lime and soda. I reckon we should just leg it up here! (CLIMBING TO LEDGE)
CONSTANCE: (FOLLOWING) ‘Leg it’ indeed. I see stairs! In the alcove ahead. Step to it, Miss Flip. You were right.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 101
QUICKSILVER: SCENE 71: INT. RUINED PASSAGEWAY BEHIND HENRY’S SHOP
HENRY: PULLING RUBBLE OUT OF WAY. SEARCHING THROUGH CABLES.
HENRY: (SEARCHING) Oh no...
STOPS: SEARCHING.
HENRY: Quicksilver! Every box... Gone!
HENRY: HE HITS WALL IN FRUSTRATION.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 102
QUICKSILVER: SCENE 72: INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
QUICKSILVER: HUMMING OF VILAL PSYCHIC DEVICES.
VILAL GENERAL: (D) Will you help us Doctor? The Zerith are vicious and cruel.
DOCTOR: From what I’ve seen, you’re not that much better. And you’re not much good at poker either.
VILAL GENERAL: (D) I do not understand.
DOCTOR: You claim you’ve some friend of mine in your power. You want to use them as leverage, but you won’t let me speak to them. I’m calling your bluff.
VILAL GENERAL: (D) There are two females known to you. They... escaped.
DOCTOR: Two? Hmm. Kinvar. Gather all the Quicksilver equipment. We’1l return it to its owners.
KINVAR: You are giving me up?
DOCTOR: Kinvar remains under my protection, but we’1ll understand one another much better if we speak face to face.
OPERATES: TARDIS DOOR CONTROL.
KINVAR: I place my trust in you, Doctor.
KINVAR: PICKS UP QUICKSILVER DEVICES.
DOCTOR: General, direct us to your ship. Even if you don’t know where my friend — or friends — might be right now, you can track your enemy. Am I right?
VILAL GENERAL: (D) We can.
DOCTOR: Then do it. I want your fight contained. (EXITING) Come on, Kinvar!
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 103
QUICKSILVER: SCENE 73: INT. CALLAHAN’S OFFICE
HENRY: CLOSES DOOR AND STANDS BEFORE DESK.
HENRY: (SALUTING) Major Callahan, sir!
CALLAHAN: You’re taking a risk coming to my office, Clarke. I’ve never seen you so rattled. Though after what happened at your shop, I’m not surprised. We’re suspending Operation Quicksilver. Orders from on high.
HENRY: Actually, Quicksilver’s already stopped, sir. Stolen... by alien parties.
CALLAHAN: This is getting out of hand. Danger to public life and limb was never part of the plan. These ‘sleeping partners’ of yours...
HENRY: They acted without my knowledge. I don’t believe they’re the same group as my initial contact after all.
CALLAHAN: (LEAFING THROUGH FILE) Mr Kinvar. Back in London. You’ve seen hide nor hair of him for years, but instead you trust these unknowns.
HENRY: The technology they gave us was the same, sir. We had no reason to believe-
CALLAHAN: OPENS DRAWER AND TAKES OUT REVOLVER.
CALLAHAN: National interests have been compromised. I think we need to move this interview to a more formal footing, Lieutenant Commander. (STANDING) Hands up.
HENRY: Are you arresting me, sir?
CALLAHAN: (SIGH) I said this cloak and dagger nonsense stunk to high heaven when I took it on. But you gave me assurances. All of you at §.1I.S. did. I helped establish your cover, gave you free rein. I didn’t expect it to blow up in our faces.
HENRY: To be fair, sir. Neither did I.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 104
CALLAHAN: We’ve handed you enough rope already, Clarke. I can’t afford to let you hang us all.
HENRY: But sir-
CALLAHAN: You give me no choice. I’1ll have to lock you up until we ascertain exactly who now has which pieces of our top secret intelligence materials!
HENRY: But I must get back to Ana-
CALLAHAN: COCKS REVOLVER.
CALLAHAN: I’m afraid that won’t be possible just yet. (CALLING) Private Rogers! In here.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 105
QUICKSILVER: SCENE 74: EXT. SEWER ENTRANCE, VIENNA STREET
METAL: DOOR IS PUSHED OPEN FROM INSIDE.
FLIP: (INSIDE) I definitely heard something behind me.
CONSTANCE: I don’t doubt it. (EFFORT)
CONSTANCE: WALKS OUT INTO COBBLES. FLIP FOLLOWS, METAL DOOR
CLANGS: CLOSED.
CONSTANCE: Actually, I’m not convinced they’re not ahead of us too.
FLIP: What do you mean?
CONSTANCE: Along the street. Sparkling lights. Quickly, this alcove.
CONSTANCE: THEY DUCK INTO A DOORWAY. SHIMMERING AND FIZZING AHEAD AS MORE
ZERITH: APPEAR.
ZERITH: (DISTORTED AS IT APPEARS) Come, sisters! The Vilal will be ended here!
CONSTANCE: (CLOSE) Idolomantis Diabolica.
FLIP: (CLOSE) Beg pardon?
CONSTANCE: Devils Flower Mantis. Always gave us a fright when they popped out of the bougainvillea.
FLIP: Still not with you.
CONSTANCE: I grew up in Africa. These creatures look rather like giant praying mantis. When I say giant, the biggest ones I saw were six inches.
FLIP: This lot must be six foot! Are they see-through? Or is that ‘cos they’re not all here? You know, teleporting in.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 106
CONSTANCE: It appears they’re made of glass.
FLIP: We shouldn’t hang about to find out.
ZERITH: START MOVING TOWARDS THEM WITH SOUNDS OF SCRAPING GLASS.
CONSTANCE: I quite agree! We should leave before they fully manifest.
CONSTANCE: CONSTANCE AND FLIP STEP ONTO COBBLED STREET AND RUN.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits)
QUICKSILVER: Page 107
QUICKSILVER: SCENE 75: EXT. BOMB CRATER, VIENNA BOMBED-OUT BACKSTREET
DOCTOR: PICKS HIS WAY OVER RUBBLE.
DOCTOR: (EFFORT) If you’re going to hide a crippled spaceship in Vienna, where better than a bomb crater?
KINVAR: (CARRYING QUICKSILVER DEVICES, WINCES) I sense them, my kind
KINVAR: are close.
KINVAR: A HATCH OPENS IN CRATER BELOW AND VILAL STOMP OUT CARRYING
KINVAR: GUNS.
VILAL GENERAL: Doctor. Here. Beneath you.
DOCTOR: Ah. General Vilal, I presume. Are all the guns absolutely
DOCTOR: necessary?
VILAL GENERAL: Guns are always necessary. We are warriors. Kinvar!
KINVAR: (AFRAID) General... I-
DOCTOR: No! Before that — have you done what I asked? Tracked down the
DOCTOR: enemy?
VILAL GENERAL: Yes. The Zerith are here and closing.
DOCTOR: You've brought an alien war to Earth.
DOCTOR: late to stop the killing.
DOCTOR: I only hope we’re not too
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 108
QUICKSILVER: SCENE 76: EXT. VIENNA STREET
ZERITH: MOVING ABOUT THE STREETS WITH GLASSY SCRAPING AND
SKITTERING: OVER COBBLESTONES. CONSTANCE AND FLIP TRY TO RUN PAST.
ZERITH: Come sisters. The Vilal are close. We shall hunt them down and eradicate them from this world.
FLIP: (RUNNING) It’s no good. They’re everywhere!
ZERITH: (APPROACHING) You! Running creatures. Stop!
ZERITH: FLIP AND CONSTANCE HALT.
CONSTANCE: (STOPPING) We should probably do as they say.
FLIP: Way ahead of you there.
ZERITH: SURROUND THEM.
CONSTANCE: (CALLING) Goodness me. You seem to have brought quite an army. In other circumstances, you’d be quite, quite beautiful.
FLIP: (CLOSE) You really think that’s gonna work?
ZERITH: What are you?
CONSTANCE: We are human beings. We are natives of this world and we will not be intimidated. I demand to know who you are and what your business is here.
FLIP: Yeah. What she said!
ZERITH: We are the Zerith and our business is war. Where are the Vilal?
FLIP: Lemme guess. They’re the shouty ones. Big on guns and armour.
QUICKSILVER: by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 109
ZERITH: We will not rest until this planet is stained black with Vilal blood.
CONSTANCE: We have just ended a long and bloody conflict of our own. I will not have you bring more suffering to our world.
FLIP: You heard her. You can all crawl off back to where you came from.
ZERITH: (NASTY LAUGH) You creatures would stand in our way? You look so soft, so vulnerable. (REACHES OUT GLASS PINCERS) I wonder, ‘human beings’. What colour is your blood?
GLASSY: SCRAPING OF INSECTOID PINCERSG...
GLASSY: END OF PART THREE

(NASTY LAUGH) You creatures would stand in our way? You look so soft, so vulnerable. (REACHES OUT GLASS PINCERS) I wonder, ‘human beings’. What colour is your blood?

SCENE 77: EXT. VIENNA STREET
STOMP INTO STREET, JUST OFF.
The Zerith are here! Engage the enemy!
FIRE WEAPONS. ZERITH SCREAM AND SHATTER.
DEATH SCREAMS
These Vilal are eager to meet their deaths!
FIRE HIGH PITCHED, CRACKLING WEAPONS. SEVERAL VILAL ARE KILLED.
DEATH ROARS
Saved, by heavy-metal goblins!
Let’s not quibble about the form salvation takes. Run!
FLIP AND CONSTANCE RUNNING ALONG STREET AS VILAL AND
FIGHT, OFF.
(RUNNING) Which way?
(RUNNING) We’re looking for the Hofburg Palace! Michaelerplatz! (‘mick-ale-ur-plats’) Anything Baroque, or neo-Baroque in style, run towards it!
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 111
(RUNNING) You know what, just ‘left’ or ‘right’ will do!
THEY RUN ON.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 112
SCENE 78: INT. VILAL SHIP
HUMMING AND PULSING AS DOCTOR WORKS ON VILAL CONTROLS.
Our squadron has engaged the Zerith.
ZERITH SIGNALS ARE BLOCKED.
There! (EFFORT) I’ve modified your ship’s scanners to block Zerith transmat signals from the vortex.
You have stopped them?
I’ve stopped reinforcements arriving. For now. All I’ve done is buy some time. Now I really must go. (HEADS TO DOORWAY)
Doctor, can I come? I don’t want to stay.
Kinvar is ours!
(STOPS) And you’1ll do nothing to harm him! Vilal, you’ve seen I can provide help and protection?
Yes. The Zerith are stalled.
Then do nothing until I return. Or else...
Or else what, Doctor?
I shall be very cross. And nobody wants that.
Is that all you threaten us with? Your anger?
(SIGHS) Don’t you see? I’m not threatening you. I’m offering to help. I’m simply asking that you don’t wire Kinvar’s brain into your systems quite yet. Not until we’ve talked about alternatives.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 113
I see. In any case, we cannot. We do not have the Helm.
The Helm?
My psychic connector. It was the first thing I got rid of. I gave it to Henry Clarke in London. His British Intelligence Service found it most interesting.
Yes, it was in the §.1I.S. files... I should track it down and take a look.
Agreed.
Good. I promise you this, Kinvar. Nobody will force you to do anything. Not while I’m around.
Thank you, Doctor.
EXITS SHIP
(GOING OFF) Now, you need reinforcements to hold the Zerith at bay. And I know where to find them.
(FX, DISTORTED VIA SCANNERS) Vilal! We are coming!
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 114
SCENE 79: EXT. VIENNA STREET
CONSTANCE AND FLIP RUN ALONG STREET.
(RUNNING) Do you think they’1ll come after us?
(RUNNING) They’re more concerned about their real enemy. We need to find the TARDIS. (SLOWING) ‘Braunerstrasse.' (‘brown-
ur-strass’) I recognise that street name.
(SLOWING) Shame I never bought an A to Z.
At the end of this road is a square. And beyond that-
RUNNING IN DISTANCE.
(CALLING, OFF) Constance!
FLIP AND CONSTANCE CHANGE DIRECTION.
(RUNNING) I don’t think we need to go that far!
(RUNNING) Doctor!
THEY RUN TO MEET UP...
(BREATHLESS) Running. We meet up again after all this time and we're running. Typical!
(APPROACHING) Flip? Philippa Jackson! What are you doing here?
THEY ALL STOP AND CATCH THEIR BREATH.

I appreciate the thought, Doctor. I do. But to be completely honest, just towels would have been nice. Wine glasses... a big sieve, maybe. Anything off the wedding list really... But no, you had to get me the flamin’ nineteen-forties!
Flip. I had no idea. What happened?
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 115
I was hoping you could explain!
(REALISES) Ah. Their leverage. It was you. I dropped your invitation. The Vilal respond to stimuli, choose the obvious course, no matter how illogical.
Nope. Still not getting it. Nothing changes, eh?
Might the reunion wait until we’re under cover and safe?
Good point, Mrs Clarke. (SETTING OFF) This way.
FLIP AND CONSTANCE FOLLOW.
But the TARDIS is along there.
Well remembered. But we need practical assistance. Major Callahan’s headquarters.
There were huge mantis creatures. Vicious things.
The Zerith. I’ve scrambled their transporter signals.
They’re having a barney with those Iron-man trolls.
Who are now our allies. It won’t take the Zerith long to break through in force. We need to protect the people of Vienna.
You think more of those glass-hoppers are coming?
I know they are, Flip.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 116
SCENE 80: EXT. VIENNA STREET
FEW ZERITH WEAPONRY BLASTS, AS SKIRMISH ENDS.
DEATH ROARS
You are all but defeated.
(WOUNDED) So are you. Four of you remain.
While all of your rabble is dead. I have more sisters coming. We will outnumber you here as we do in our home system. Your world is surrounded. We came for the cowards who ran.
We did not run. We came here seeking victory.
A pity you will not live to find it. (CALLS) Kill this last one.
FIRE WEAPONS.
DEATH CRY
ZERITH SIGNALS.
Where are my sisters? Why can they not pass through the vortex? Who interferes?!
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 117
SCENE 81: INT. CORRIDOR, BRITISH HQ
LEADS DOCTOR, CONSTANCE AND FLIP ALONG CORRIDOR BUSTLING WITH MILITARY PERSONNEL.
(HURRYING AFTER CALLAHAN) My husband is in custody, Major Callahan? Whatever else he may be, Henry is no traitor.
Love does strange things to men’s loyalties, Mrs Clarke.
You don’t need to tell me that.
(CLOSE, TO DOCTOR) Doctor, her husband’s shacked up with some other woman. She thought it was me at first!
Oh Constance. I’m sorry. I had no idea-
I know you’ve no idea when it comes to certain things, Doctor.
You can say that again.
THEY WALK BY HENRY’S CELL.
He’s in there.
THEY STOP. HENRY COMES TO THE BARS.
(JUST OFF) Constance! Please.
(STOPPING) Might I have a moment?
A moment. No more.
Come on, Doctor. Looks like everyone’s going through here. (HEADING OFF) Ooh. Look at all the uniforms!
BUSTLES THE DOCTOR OFF TOWARDS OPERATIONS ROOM.
Major? We’ll be waiting for you. Please hurry. (FOLLOWS FLIP)
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 118
Constance. Please. (SOTTO) You’ve got to persuade the Major to let me out.
I’m sorry, Henry. But one makes one’s own fortune in war. And one must live with the consequences. — We were going to your
operations room, Major?
WALKS ON.
Constance!
Pity. I was hoping someone might be able to talk some sense into him. I’ve had no luck. Rogers, keep an eye.
Sir!
The rest of you men, with me.
Sir!
CALLAHAN AND SOLDIERS WALK ON.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 119
SCENE 82: INT. OPERATIONS ROOM.
ENTERS.
Constance?
You OK?
Don’t fuss. Either of you. We’ve a job to do.
ENTERS WITH TROOPS.
I’ll get on to my counterparts in the French and American zones. What you say appears to be true: I’ve reports of an ‘alien engagement’. Shots fired. We need to muster the troops.

Please, Major. We simply need a show of numbers. Do not antagonise them. Your visitors are only interested in each other. The human race is an irritation. But one they have no qualms about removing if it gets in their way. Defensive measures only!
I’1l make that decision once we know what we are dealing with. Wren Clarke? You wanted to see the city maps.
CONSTANCE AND CALLAHAN LOOK OVER MAPS.
Yes sir, this is where Philippa and I saw the mantis creatures gathering.
Most useful. I’1l take every man I have available, establish a perimeter, along here.
And Major, I believe you have a device in your safe which is vital for the safety of this world.
First things first, Doctor. (EXITING, CALLING) Sergeant! Have the troops fall in! Everybody, outside now!
HEADS OUT WITH MARCHING TROOPS.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 120
I’1l check outside. Zerith forces could break through at any time. (SOTTO) And I still need to come up with some alternative plan...
(CLOSE) What can I do Doctor? I feel like a spare wheel with all this G I Joe stuff.
Come with me, Flip. There’s a lost soul in need of some
guidance.
You think I’1l be any use?
You’ve never let me down so far.
DOCTOR AND FLIP EXITING TO CORRIDOR.
(WALKING) Just like old times. Back in the thick of it.
(WALKING) Flip. It’s good to see you. How was your wedding day?
I’1l let you know when it’s finished!
EVACUATE HQ, AND HURRY ON PAST.
MUSIC SEGUE.
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 121
SCENE 83: INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE HENRY’S CELL, BRITISH HO

EFFORT OF LANDING) Stay away! (FIRES

SCENE 100: EXT. VIENNA STREET

(FX) Gentlemen?

Ah. Constance, Flip. I’m sorry. Peacekeeping is quite distracting.

Quite irresponsible. It is this young lady’s wedding day, after all. I believe I may have missed a few years myself.
This treaty must take priority. The earliest stages are most delicate.
Sounds to me like you’1ll need some help. I’ma ‘very level- headed young woman’ after all!

As previously agreed.
(SIGH) I don’t stand a chance against the two of you, do I? (ENTERING TARDIS) Come along, then, ladies!
(LAUGHS) You and me, Connie. I reckon we’ve got him on the ropes.
Quite. And kindly address me as... (BREAKS OFF)
by Matt Fitton (003—AB edits) Page 149
